Rule.Name: Method return values should generally not be ignored
Rule.Description: When a method returns a value, it is generally an error to ignore the return value.
Rule.Resolution: Consider using the value returned by the call to method '{0}' made from method '{1}'.
Consider using the value returned by the boxing operation in method '{0}'.
Consider using the value returned by the object allocation made from method '{0}'.
Consider using the value returned by the array creation made from method '{0}'.
Consider using the value returned by the call of delegate type '{0}' made from method '{1}'.
